text: Cootamundra, an electoral district of the Legislative Assembly in the Australian state of New South Wales, was created in 1904 and was abolished in 1941, returning one member until 1920, three members from 1920 to 1927 and one member from 1927 to 1941. It was recreated in 2015. ==Members for Cootamundra== ===First incarnation=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" | Single-member (1904–1920) |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Party!!Term |- | | | rowspan="2"|William Holman | | 1904–1917 |- | | | | 1917–1920 |- |} {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="12" | Three members (1920–1927) |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Party!!Term!!colspan="2"|Member!!Party!!Term!!colspan="2"|Member!!Party!!Term |- | rowspan="2" | | rowspan="4"|Hugh Main | rowspan="2"| | rowspan="2"|1920–1925 | rowspan="3" | | rowspan="4"|Peter Loughlin | rowspan="3"| | rowspan="3"|1920–1926 | | | Greg McGirr | | 1920–1922 |- | | | James McGirr | | 1922–1925 |- | rowspan="2" | | rowspan="2"| | rowspan="2"|1925-1927 | | | rowspan="2"|Ken Hoad | rowspan="2"| | rowspan="2"|1925–1927 |- | | | | 1926–1927 | | |- |} {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" | Single-member (1927–1941) |- !colspan="2"|Member!!Party!!Term |- | | | Ken Hoad | | 1927–1932 |- | | | Bill Ross | | 1932–1941 |} ===Second incarnation=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="4" | Single-member (2015–present) |- | | | Katrina Hodgkinson | | 2015–2017 |- | | | Steph Cooke | | 2017–present |} ==Election results== ===Elections in the 2010s=== ====2019==== ====2017 by-election==== ====2015==== ====1941 - 2015==== ===Elections in the 1930s=== ====1938==== ====1935==== ====1932==== ====1930==== ===Elections in the 1920s=== ====1927==== ====1925==== ====1922==== ====1920==== ===Elections in the 1910s=== ====1917==== ====1913==== ====1910==== ===Elections in the 1900s=== ====1907==== ====1906 by-election==== ====1904==== ==Notes== ==References== Category:New South Wales state electoral results by district
